narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
comments: The Code Analysis project, while useful for understanding codes felt odd as a presentation especially after we had already discussed our findings during our field trip as a group.

Expectations for the group projects were not perfectly clear. This is likely due to the presence of a large number of auditors in the class. Gene wanted the auditors to participate in any meetings outside of class for the group project (the code analysis) but that was never really made clear to the enrolled students. In general, integrating auditors--assuming it happens again--may need a little more planning.

narratives.question_text: How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: Can't wait to read Gene's book.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?

comments: The final project is fairly substantial, but was the most valuable learning tool of the semester.

Technically, I was auditing the class though I did end up doing several of the projects. In particular, the final project seemed well reasoned and proportioned. The parameters provided were a good jumping off point.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: I think the quizzes need to be updated and revolve around knowledge of concepts and facts over questions with arguable answers. It was odd upon grading the quizzes in class to throw out certain questions for being the subject of dispute.
Gene threw out some of the questions on his own quizzes after discussing them with the class. In general, quizzes like this are an excellent means to help encourage comprehension of the material.

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: There is not really Theatre Planning production work at this school. It did help me understand more about building safety codes which some how could be applicable to production work.
This class is not Production-Oriented. General knowledge of how theaters are built is of course useful.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Highest level of expert in the field.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: Having Scott Conn come into the final class was amazing. If possible it might be nice to have him come in prior to the final to share his insights on where to start with the final project.
Lectures often felt rushed and we fell an entire week behind over the course of the semester, and it felt like we missed out on some important content.

it was difficult for me to understand the entire big picture relationships between aesthetics, codes and requirements. I did not pay much attention to aesthetics in my final assignment, putting more time into making sure the code requirements were met and that the backstage provided all the requirements that it needs to. I still am not clear whether consultants decide the interior design of the final architecture and are hired as architects or consultants. The books recommended did help a lot.
